meanings.definition: The arrangement of natural and artificial physical features of an area.
meanings.sent1: The topograph of the park showed where the trees and benches were placed.
meanings.sent2: The topograph of the city displayed the roads, buildings, and rivers.
meanings.sent3: I tripped over the topograph of the playground, which was drawn on the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her face was a topograph of emotions, revealing every contour of her feelings.
meanings.sent5: The topograph of the mountain range was etched in my memory, its peaks and valleys vividly clear.

meanings.definition: A detailed description or representation on a map of the natural and artificial physical features of an area.
meanings.sent1: The explorer carried a topograph to navigate through the dense forest.
meanings.sent2: The topograph of the island included information about its flora and fauna.
meanings.sent3: The detective used the topograph to track down the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a topograph of memories, each one carefully mapped out.
meanings.sent5: The topograph of the battlefield helped the general strategize his next move.

meanings.definition: The study or practice of making maps or charts of the physical features of an area.
meanings.sent1: She specialized in topograph and created accurate maps of different terrains.
meanings.sent2: The class learned about topograph and its importance in geography.
meanings.sent3: The topograph enthusiast spent hours perfecting the details on his maps.
meanings.sent4: His room was filled with books on topograph, showcasing his passion for cartography.
meanings.sent5: The topograph expert was called in to map out the new national park.
